to the State of Pennsylvania.


Ben: enacted By Me Senate and House Of
REPRESENTATIVES Of The Uaitca States eJ n
77erica in Congress assembled, That the
proper accounting officers Of the Treasury De.
partment be, and they are hereby, authorized.
and directed TO iquidate and settle the clam Of
the State Of Pennsylvania against the United
States, for interest upon loans or moneys bor.
rowed, and actually expended BY her, ful the
'lie and benefit OF the United States, during the
late war with Great Britain.


SIC. ? Ind be il tuftder enacted, That
N Rscertaining the amount of interest as afore.
said, due to the State Of Pennsylvania, the fol-
lowing rules shall be understood as applicable to,
and governing the case, to wit; First, that inter
eat shall not be computed on any sum which
Pennsylvania has not expended for the use and
benefit Of the United States. Second, that no
interest shall be paid on any sum on which she
has not paid interest. Third, that when the pin
cipal, or any part of it, has been paid OF refund
cd by the United States, or money placed in tht
hands Of Pennsylvania for that purpose, the in
tcrest on the sum or sums so paid or refunded
shall cease, and not be considered as chargeabl
to the United States any longer than up to III
time of the repayment, rs aforesaid.


SEC. 5. .dnd be ii further enacted, Tha
the amount of interest, wheI~ ascertained, a
aforesaid, shall be paid out of any money in tn
Treasury, not otherwise appropriated.


Approved; March 3, 1927
